overview: Jaisalmer, the "Golden City" of Rajasthan, sits on the edge of the Thar Desert. Its living Jaisalmer Fort, sandstone havelis, Gadisar Lake and desert safaris make it a popular budget-friendly destination for Indian travelers.
topAttractions: Jaisalmer War Museum and Folklore Museum
travelTips: Travel early (before 9 AM) to avoid crowds and heat.
Use state buses (₹2–₹3 per km) or shared auto‑rickshaws for cheap local transport.
Avoid the expensive prepaid taxi from the airport; opt for a regular taxi or bus.
Eat at local eateries where meals cost around ₹20.
Shop outside the fort for better prices on leather, silk and silver items.
Carry plenty of water and stay hydrated, especially during desert trips.
If trying bhang, consume only one drink, eat beforehand, and stay hydrated.
Book camel safaris through reputable operators and compare prices.
